alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Licking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 10:21PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF DELAWARE AND NORTHWESTERN LICKING COUNTIES THROUGH 1100 PM EDT... At 1020 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Ashley, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Locations impacted include... Delaware, Johnstown, Sunbury, Utica, Ashley, Granville South, Radnor, Galena, Alexandria, Hartford, St. Louisville, Interstate 71 at US Route 36/State Route 37, Alum Creek State Park, Delaware State Park, Fredonia, US Route 62 at State Route 661, Olive Green, Stratford, State Route 310 at State Route 161 and Warrensburg. This includes I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 126 and 138. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
